meanings.definition: An area enclosed to keep animals out.
meanings.sent1: The exclosures in the park protect the delicate plants from being eaten by rabbits.
meanings.sent2: The exclosures around the garden prevent deer from entering and damaging the crops.
meanings.sent3: The exclosures at the zoo make sure the monkeys don't escape and cause mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her room became an exclosures when she put up a 'Do Not Disturb' sign.
meanings.sent5: The exclosures in the forest create safe spaces for the wildlife to thrive.

meanings.definition: The act of excluding or shutting out.
meanings.sent1: The exclosures of certain students from the club upset the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The exclosures from the meeting left some employees feeling left out.
meanings.sent3: His exclosures from the party made him realize he needed to be more social.
meanings.sent4: The exclosures of negative thoughts helped her focus on the positive.
meanings.sent5: The exclosures of distractions allowed him to finish his work efficiently.
